column5: This village was mentioned in the domesday book, but has since been washed away by coastal erosion.
When water levels are low, the gateposts of derwent school are visible.
The village of Nether Hambleton was completely flooded, but St. Matthew's church was saved (if partially submerged) - when Rutland Water was created by planned flooding.
The village was flooded during the creation of Thruscross Reservoir.
The church and other village buildings are now under the waters of Ponsticill reservoir
Mardale is now under Haweswater, but if the water level is very low, features of the village (such as an old foot-bridge) become visible.
The village was flooded in the creation of Llyn Celyn Reservoir.
